title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 896.4 - Service complaints
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 896.4 - Service complaints

State Regulations
(a) Pursuant to
47 C.F.R. section
76.607, and in accordance with section 890.70
of this Title, service complaints from subscribers about the quality of
television signals shall be addressed initially to the commission prior to
referral to the Federal Communications Commission. Cable television companies
shall establish a process for resolving complaints about service quality and
shall maintain such complaints for a period of one year. Aggregate data based
upon such complaints shall be made available for inspection by the commission
and municipal franchising authorities upon request. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
896.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
